title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 167.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 167.2 - Definitions

State Regulations

As used in this Part: (a) Agency means a person or persons, a firm, a corporation or a private organization making application for
approval. (b) Approved means
approved by the Commissioner of Education for programs operated pursuant to
section 123 and section 141(o) of JTPA. (c) Basic skills means basic literacy, pre-high school equivalency, high school equivalency, English as a second
language and computer literacy. (d) Curriculum means a series of intended learning outcomes which together comprise
a program of instruction. (e) Occupational skills means those abilities necessary to obtaining and
maintaining employment which have a demonstrable and direct relationship to
employment. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
167.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
